Module guigame
Package guigame.gui.menu.submenus

Class GUISelectUsersSubmenu

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
javax.swing.JComponent
javax.swing.JPanel
guigame.gui.panes.GUIPanel
guigame.gui.menu.GUIMenu
guigame.gui.menu.submenus.GUISelectUsersSubmenu
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class GUISelectUsersSubmenu
extends GUIMenu
An implementation of GUIMenu which lets the user select whether they want to play as one player against an artificial intelligence or let two AIs play against each other.

IMPORTANT: To the panel, only the buttons will be added. Add the name inputs manually.

See Also:
getTextFieldPanel(), Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • GUISelectUsersSubmenu

      public GUISelectUsersSubmenu​(Players players)
      Create a new Submenu for the player selection.
      Parameters:
      players - the currently selected / defined players to be eventually changed

  • Method Details

    • addActionListeners

      private void addActionListeners​(PlayersChangedEventListener playersChangedEventListener)
      Add action listeners to buttons.
      Parameters:
      playersChangedEventListener - The listener for PlayersChangedEvents.

    • addTextFields

      private void addTextFields()
      Add the text fields to panel. Get this panel and add it to the main menu manually.
      See Also:
      getTextFieldPanel(), firstPlayerInput, secondPlayerInput

    • getTextFieldPanel

      public GUIPanel getTextFieldPanel()
      Returns:
      the GUIPanel with the text fields of both player's names

    • addButtons

      private void addButtons()
      Add buttons to panel and mark the right one as selected.
      See Also:
      twoAI, oneAI

    • setButtonsSelected

      private void setButtonsSelected()
      Set the right button as selected. Based on the second (right) player's isAI-method.
      See Also:
      Player.isAI()

    • playersChanged

      public void playersChanged​(int nrOfHumans)
      The number of humans was changed; so the players are reset. Then the button of the selected number is selected.
      Parameters:
      nrOfHumans - the new number of humans (among the players)
      See Also:
      playersChanged(int, String), setButtonsSelected()

    • playersChanged

      public void playersChanged​(int index, java.lang.String newName)
      The name of one player is changed; this name is applied.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the player whose name has been changed
      newName - the new name of the player
      See Also:
      playersChanged(int), setButtonsSelected()
